data_scout.executor¶

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

Executor

This is the abstract executor. It contains the base method every executor should implement.

PandasExecutor

Execute a pipeline in Pandas.

CodeExecutor

This is the abstract executor. It contains the base method every executor should implement.

SparkExecutor

This is the abstract executor. It contains the base method every executor should implement.
class data_scout.executor.Executor(data_source: dict, pipeline: List[dict], scout: data_scout.scout.Scout)¶

This is the abstract executor. It contains the base method every executor should implement.

abstract join(self, left, right, on_left: List[str], on_right: List[str], how: str)¶
load_data(self, use_sample: bool = False, sampling_technique: str = 'top') → List[dict]¶
abstract _make_dataframe(self, records: List[dict])¶

Make a dataframe. :param records: The input records (list for Pandas, RDD for PySpark) :return:

abstract _fix_missing_columns(self, records: List[dict])¶

Make sure that each row in the dataset has the same keys. :param records: The input records (list for Pandas, RDD for PySpark) :return:

abstract _get_columns(self, records: List[dict]) → Tuple[dict, Any]¶

Get a list of column_name: column_type dicts.

Parameters

records – A list of all records

Returns

A list of column names and their types and a complete dataframe

abstract _apply(self, records, transformation: data_scout.transformations.transformation.Transformation)¶
abstract _apply_flatten(self, records, transformation: data_scout.transformations.transformation.Transformation)¶

Apply a function that expands the records

Parameters

records –

Returns

abstract _apply_global(self, records, transformation: data_scout.transformations.transformation.Transformation)¶

Apply a function to all the records (group bys, etc.)

Parameters

records –

Returns

abstract _filter(self, records)¶

Filter all elements that are False

Parameters

records –

Returns

_get_transformations(self) → List[Tuple[int, dict, Type[data_scout.transformations.transformation.Transformation]]]¶
_get_sampling_technique(self, requested_technique: str, transformation_list: List[Tuple[int, dict, Type[data_scout.transformations.transformation.Transformation]]])¶
__call__(self, use_sample: bool = True, sampling_technique: str = 'top', column_types: bool = False)¶

Execute the pipeline that this executor was initialized with.

Parameters

  • use_sample – Should the data be sampled?

  • sampling_technique – What sampling technique to use (only if use_sample is true)?

  • column_types – Should the column types of all steps be returned? If not, an empty list is returned

Returns

A list of dictionary objects representing the data and a list of dicts representing the columns and

column types.

_make_data_source(self)¶
_class_name(self, o)¶

Get the fully classified class name of a certain type.

Parameters

o – The class

Returns

__call__(self, use_sample: bool = True, sampling_technique: str = 'top', column_types: bool = False)¶

Create a piece of code that will execute all of the steps in Pandas.

Parameters

  • use_sample – Not used

  • sampling_technique – Not used

  • column_types – Not used

Returns

A string containing the code and an empty list.
